content.rendered:
Here’s a look back at Lauren and Patrick’s trendy wedding with a neutral color palette that we haven’t stopped dreaming about at The Bell Tower. 

Lauren, from Nebraska, and Patrick, from Texas, met in Music City back in 2014 over some light-hearted fun on a well-known app, Tinder! The pair instantly hit it off and spent the next five years adventuring and growing together. 

Knowing it would be tough to surprise Lauren, he chose a sweet at-home proposal surrounded by their friends and family. With approval from Lauren’s father and a reset diamond from Patrick’s mother, he tied a handmade sign around their shared furry friend and “finally” popped the question. 

When it came to planning the big day, it was important to Lauren, an interior designer, that the setting and decor be just what she dreamed! Thankfully, with the help of many and The Bell Tower’s “beauty,” we did just that. 

On their May wedding day, Lauren’s bridesmaids wore beige-colored dresses paired with soft pink bouquets, and Patrick’s groomsmen were all dressed up in matching tan suits and brown leather shoes. 

The ceremony was held in the main space with lush greenery lining the aisles and a backdrop made with garlands of dried wax paper, created by Lauren and her mother.

After the vows, guests mingled for a cocktail hour and grabbed a custom koozie as Infinity staff flipped the ceremony space. The reception was designed with mixed table settings featuring minimalist yet trendy centerpieces, greenery runners, and neutral linens.

Guests found their seats for a dinner of lemon and herb baked chicken with broccolini and goat cheese polenta, smoked brisket with grilled corn and bacon whipped potatoes, and bourbon-glazed salmon with grilled asparagus and parmesan risotto. 

Lauren and Patrick later shared their first dance to “On My Way to You” by Cody Johnson, followed by the sweetest father-daughter dance with a special performance by the groom. Then  the dance floor was opened, as was the tasting room, filling the night with lots of love and laughter!

Keep scrolling to see all the details from Lauren and Patrick’s neutral wedding day.

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: May 23rd, 2021
Bride & Groom: Lauren and Patrick
Location: The Bell Tower
Colors: Neutrals
Photographer: Megan Cash
Florist: Forget Me Not Designs
Cake: Publix
Dress: Ready or Knot
Bridesmaids: Show Me Your MuMu
Paper Goods: Paper Crush
Linens: Event Works
DJ: DJ Dan Buckley
Catering & Bar: The Bell Tower
Production Design: Nashville Lighting & Production
Planning: Cassidy, Kacey + Haley  | IH

excerpt.rendered: A trendy Spring wedding ceremony and reception with a neutral color palette at The Bell Tower.
